resources.string:
Your brush head wears out and loses performance depending on the type of brush, the amount of pressure applied while brushing and how long you have been brushing.

Over months of normal use, brush heads gradually wear down and lose their stiffness. For the best results it’s important to replace at least every 3 months.

A smart algorithm, combines data from the sensors and the Smartlink chip in the brush head. This app gives you accurate and personalized brush head replacement reminders based on an algorithm.

But now you can get smarter about this! dsa
Calibration can only be successful if the handle is steady.
I want to help improve the app and have a more personal experience based on my app data.

If you provide consent, we process your mobile device and app usage information to improve the app and connected devices, as well as providing you with personalized services. This includes: fafasfsa fsa fafas fsaasfasf fafas fsafas fafas Providing you support, as well as obtaining feedback and other service-related communications fafas Analyzing changes or features across different groups to understand interactions fafas Understanding how the app is accessed and used to directly link to specific app sections fafas Combining, pseudonymizing, anonymizing or aggregating your data for statistical and analytics purposes The data processed includes mobile device identifiers, session and usage data, operating system, model, carrier, network information and (masked) IP addresses, and app information, such as app name, version, usage and events, pages visited, session information, and connected device data. To do so, we may use several service providers that process your app information on our behalf and pursuant to our instructions. Our service providers may use cookies, tags and/or similar technologies to help us process this information. We may also use your information to invite you to participate in optional surveys or research projects organized by the Philips group of companies.

If you provide consent, you will help us to improve the app and our connected products (as well as develop new oral healthcare solutions for you!) based on the data we observe and collect when you use our services. We do so by: 

 fafas		Assessing how you use the app and how the app performs on your mobile device, including when the app crashes to identify and fix issues
 fafas		Implementing and analyzing changes or features across different groups to understand interactions
 fafas		Evaluating how the app is accessed and used and directly link you to specific app sections
 fafas		Interacting with you to obtain your feedback, supporting you when required, and sending you service-related communications
 fafas		Inviting you to participate in surveys or research projects organized by the philips group

 We may also use these insights to further personalize our services.

 The data processed may include mobile device identifiers, session and usage data, operating system, model, carrier, network, information and (masked)IP addresses, and app information, such as app name, version, usage and events, pages visited, session information, and connected device data. We may use cookies, tags and/or similar technologies, and use service providers that process your details on our behalf and based on our instructions. fsa
When you accept, you will be a part of improving the app and future experiences. Are you sure you don\'t want to help?
If you change your mind, you can always go to your Settings in the Menu.
I want to link my data with Apple Health.
You’re on your way to having even more insight into your oral health. Simply grant permission to link your data using the steps below.

When you authorize the app to link with Apple Health, you allow Philips Sonicare to write data to and read data from Apple Health. The data exchanged includes your brushing duration. You can turn off sharing at any time.
You’ve enabled syncing with Apple Health.
You can change settings when the toothbrush is connected.

The toothbrush you connected is not supported by the SonicPro app.
Keep the toothbrush close to the phone and leave the app open
Do not switch away from the app
Make sure your toothbrush is turned off and not on its charger
If you are still having trouble, please contact customer care %s.

Please select \"Allow all the time\" if you want the Sonicare app to be able to automatically collect brushing history when the app is closed and your phone is near your toothbrush. An up-to-date history improves the brushing tips Sonicare provides.

fsa fsa fsa fsa SONICARE and the Sonicare logo are trademarks of KPNV. The Bluetooth® word mark and logos are registered trademarks owned by the Bluetooth SIG, Inc. and any use of such marks by KPNV is under license. Tiny Habits® is a registered trademark of BJ Fogg, LLC. fsa

Philips’ goal of bringing you continual, complete oral care solutions and innovations reaches beyond technology to your oral care insurance support. That is why Philips offers you the possibility to share your brushing data with Bcbs in accordance with the BrushSmart Program User Agreement. To protect your privacy, Philips ensures that all shared data is sent in a secure way. What does this mean?
Take your first tiny step towards \n big oral health benefits!
Welcome to the Philips \n Sonicare Dental + program.
You will lose all data associated with this brush head. Are you sure you want to delete it?

When your sessions reach the red zone, your brush head is no longer effective.
You will need to attach a brush head to your handle to see your brush head status.
Save up to 20% when you subscribe
The blue brush head reminder bristles fade out over time to indicate that the brush head is wearing out.
Show me all my brush heads ›
This brush head is used by a different account.
Don\'t miss our biggest Black Friday deals! From personal care to home solutions, get the best for less.
To connect to your toothbrush, you\'ll need to turn on Bluetooth.
To connect to your toothbrush and provide personalized tips, Sonicare needs to access nearby devices.
Your handle should be charged for connected brushing. Place it in the charger to charge it.
Your handle should be off of the charger and its lights should be on. If no lights, press the mode button on your handle:
Still no lights? Check battery (see next step)
Please select \"While using the app\" so your toothbrush can connect.
Your Sonicare toothbrush needs to connect to this app via Bluetooth. We need you to provide location access, because Android requires it to enable Bluetooth connectivity.
Sonicare never tracks your geographic location.
Still not connecting? Please contact support
Bluetooth needs to be enabled on your phone in order to connect to your handle.
Try resetting Bluetooth (OFF and then ON) on your phone to connect your handle.
Unable to connect to your handle
We use Bluetooth to connect to your toothbrush. Simply tap the button to turn it on.
We use Bluetooth to connect to your toothbrush. Go to your phone settings or control center to turn it on. When you are all set, return to the app to continue.
Bluetooth permission for the Sonicare app has been disabled
Sorry, your internet browser is not supported for registration. Please download and install Google Chrome or Microsoft Edge and try again.
I want to help improve the app based on my app usage data.
We take your oral health very seriously and use your brushing information to provide guidance and solutions for you in the app.
I want to receive brushing guidance based on my oral care information.

When you consent to receiving brushing guidance you allow Philips Sonicare to improve your oral health. We do so by keeping track of your progress and goals and providing personalized advice. The oral care information we process includes your brushing patterns, goals, oral care habits, focus areas, and any personalization responses you provide, which are associated to your account.

When you consent to receiving brushing guidance, you allow Philips Sonicare to improve your oral health. We do so by keeping track of your progress and goals and providing personalized advice. The oral care information we process includes your brushing patterns, goals, oral care habits (such as flossing and rinsing), and your answers in our Personalization page and Focus Area (such as plaque build-up, bleeding areas, gum recession and potential cavities), which we associate to your account.
Consider brushing more in the highlighted areas.

We can only provide you with personalized oral care feedback, brushing history and brushing guidance if you allow us. \n\nHave questions? Each of your privacy settings can be reviewed and updated at any time.
Uh-oh. It looks like you haven’t allowed us to access your oral care information

fafas Each spike on the wheel corresponds to a unique brushing session

fafas The length of the spike indicates the pressure applied

fafas The width of the spike is the time you brushed and pressure combined

fafas When you reach the red zone your brush head is no longer as effective and it's time to replace!
2 liner description of every consistency data will go here.
Brush your tongue with a back and forth motion, try to cover the entire area.
Try to brush as far back on your tongue as you can comfortably.
2 liner description of every consistency data will go here.
2 liner description of every consistency data will go here.
Simply attach your smart brush head and your toothbrush will automatically set the ideal mode and intensity, for you, every time.
Always know exactly when it\'s time to replace your smart brush head. Because replacement is based on your actual usage, you\'ll get the most out of every brush head.
Place your handle standing up on a flat surface while we calibrate it
Is your brush on a flat surface?
How can I check brush head?
There\'s a smart brush head for all your oral care needs. Be sure to choose the brush head options that are best for you.
Your handle must be in Clean or White mode for real-time guidance.\n\nPlease turn your handle off, and switch to Clean or White mode for real-time guidance.
This will delete your previous handle from your account.
Reach maximum comfort with three adjustable intensity levels: low, medium and high.
Please keep your handle off the charger and stay close!

This will delete your previous handle from your account. Tap \'yes\' to delete your old toothbrush from your app account and from the brush head reordering service. To continue receiving automatic brush head reordering, set up your new toothbrush to the brush head reordering service, when prompted.

Would you like to continue without syncing the latest brushing sessions? Tap \'yes\' to delete your old toothbrush from your app account and from the brush head reordering service. To continue receiving automatic brush head reordering, set up your new toothbrush to the brush head reordering service, when prompted.
Wet the micro bristles before you turn on your handle to brush
Nice work! Enjoy the fresh breath that comes with a healthy tongue.
Rinse your mouth and start your brush to continue for the second session.
Only one more to go! \n Rinse your mouth and start your brush to continue.
Wet the micro bristles and brush your tongue with a back and forth motion. Clean as far back as comfortable.
Rinse your mouth and repeat the procedure two more times.
Please keep your handle on the charger and stay close!
Your handle is up to date
Make sure your handle is turned off before starting the troubleshooting process.

Never worry about brushing too hard. To protect your gums, the pressure sensor vibrates when you apply too much pressure.
Receive important information about your brushing habits and progress. Reports are your simple, reliable guide to maintaining a healthy mouth and smile.

Research shows that brushing 2 minutes can remove nearly 50% of plaque-causing bacteria in your mouth.
No need to push. Let the toothbrush do the work. Applying too much pressure can lead to gum recession.
Looks like you\'ve been scrubbing. Scrubbing can be a hard habit to break, but it is never needed with your Sonicare. Let the electric toothbrush do the work.

Simply turn your Bluetooth off and then on again to reset so we can connect to your toothbrush.
Your Bluetooth might need to be reset
Simply go to your phone settings and allow Bluetooth for Sonicare. When you are all set, return to the app to continue so we can connect to your toothbrush.
We use Bluetooth to connect to your toothbrush. Simply go to your phone settings to turn it on. When you are all set, return to the app to continue.

Here's how to do that:

fafas Go to your phone settings
fafas Open Bluetooth
fafas Tap on Philips Sonicare and choose 'Forget' or 'Unpair'
fafas Return to the Sonicare app and accept the pairing request
Your toothbrush is connected, and your latest brushing sessions are syncing to the app.

If your toothbrush has ever been connected to a different device, disable Bluetooth on the other device. Be sure that only the toothbrush that you want to connect with is off the charger with the lights on and close to you.
We’re gathering your brushing history so we can provide the most personalized experience.\n\nThis can take a few minutes, so just stay close to your toothbrush while we finish up!
Keep your toothbrush close to sync

Here's how to do that:

fafas Go to your phone settings
fafas Open Bluetooth
fafas Tap on the info icon, and select \‘Forget This Device\’ for Philips Sonicare
fafas Return to the Sonicare app and accept the pairing request
Let’s try pairing your toothbrush again
Simply open the app and wake up your handle to connect it. Once your handle is connected, it will automatically sync available brushing data.
How do I sync my handle?
This can happen if you move your phone away from your toothbrush while syncing. Simply bring the phone near your brush again and check that the lights are on.
We couldn\'t sync your brushing information
Be sure that only the toothbrush that you want to connect with is off the charger with the lights on and is close to you.
It looks like you might need some assistance. We can help!

Here's how to do that:

fafas Place the toothbrush on its original charger
fafas Press and release the power button 10 times within 5 seconds while toothbrush remains on the charger
fafas When all the lights turn on in rapid succession, the reset is complete
fafas Return to the Sonicare app and accept the pairing request
You might need to reset your toothbrush

By tapping below, I instruct Philips to share my brushing data with Delta Dental

When you connect your toothbrush to the Sonicare App (“App”), Philips (“Philips”, “we” or “us”) provides its own services to you and processes your personal data in accordance with the App’s Privacy Notice. You may also instruct Philips to share your personal data with other third parties for purposes outside the services Philips provides – and we understand that you would like us to do so for purposes of the BrushSmart Program. Therefore, by tapping on “Agree and continue” you are instructing and authorizing Philips to share the following data with Delta Dental for purposes of the BrushSmart Program:
Your Delta Dental coupon IDs, which you use in our websites.

Please note that when you instruct us to share your personal data with Delta Dental, they could use such personal data for its own purposes in accordance with their Privacy Notices and the BrushSmart Program User Agreement. You understand that Philips (i) may receive a commercial benefit when disclosing your information, however, Delta Dental will only use your information for purposes of the BrushSmart Program; and (ii) may process your personal data at various times for the purposes mentioned above.
Your brushing data, including your associated unique identifier(s), brushing date, time, stamp [AM/PM], duration and mode and type of brush-head.
This authorization will remain valid indefinitely from the time you tap on \'Agree and continue\'. You can always cancel this authorization sooner by revoking your consent under the App settings.

Your App unique identifiers, which are randomly generated and allow us to identify you. We use and share these identifiers to inform Delta Dental that you have requested us to share your personal data with them and that you have provided consent and started brushing.

Philips’ goal of bringing you continual, complete oral care solutions and innovations reaches beyond technology to your oral care insurance support. That is why Philips offers you the possibility to share your brushing data with Delta Dental in accordance with the BrushSmart Program User Agreement. To protect your privacy, Philips ensures that all shared data is sent in a secure way. What does this mean?
Delta Dental is a registered trademark of Delta Dental Plans Association.

Warning! Changing this setting will permanently delete your data. Do not proceed unless prepared to delete all app history. Don’t forget, you have registered to the automatic brush head reordering service. By tapping \'Ok\', your reordering service will be discontinued.

This App uses Firebase Crashlytics (“Firebase”), which is an app development service provided by Google Ireland Ltd. (“Google”). Firebase uses “cookies” or similar technologies, which are text files placed in your App. On behalf of Philips, Firebase will collect the following information from your device: Installation UUID and Crash traces. We use this information to evaluate and understand your use of the App, to test and analyze the App crashes and ultimately optimize our products and services.

This App uses Google Firebase, an app development service (“Firebase”) provided by Google Ireland Ltd. (“Google”). Firebase uses “cookies” or similar techniques- SDK, which are text files placed in your App and web browser.\n\n On behalf of Philips, Firebase will use information from your device such as your Device ID, IP address, your IDFA or Google Play Services ID and your MAC address, and replace them with a unique code. When you use the App we will measure the numbers of visits to the App, which pages you visit, your network connection, load times and when the app crashes. We use this information to evaluate and understand your use of the App, to test and analyze performance and ultimately optimize our products and services.
I want to share my app usage and crash data to optimize the App and receive personalized services.
Changing this setting will permanently delete your data. Do not proceed unless prepared to delete all app history.

Welcome back! See below for your brushing trends, tips, notices and more.
Gentle trim profile is designed to cushion teeth for an extra gentle brushing
Automatically senses your applied pressure and adapts to protect your gums.
The intensity setting adjusts the power of the brushing motion for your comfort. For optimal results, high intensity is recommended.
It removes plaque with superior efficiency in a two-minute program. If you’re going to stick to one mode, make it this one.
Alerts you if you are scrubbing too hard with light and gentle vibration.
If you brush with too much pressure over an extended period, your toothbrush handle will briefly pause then automatically lower the intensity level.
fafas Your toothbrush battery is out\nfafas Pick up your toothbrush to connect\nfafas Bluetooth is on
Unknown error occurs. Please try again later.
Extended version of Clean mode is the ideal choice for when you want to pay extra attention to trouble spots.
Adds extra time of reduced power brushing to gently massage your gums for better circulation and ultimately better gum health.
Vibrates with lower power, going easier on your teeth and gums.
The settings below are not available in tongue care mode. Once you attach your regular brush head, they will be available again.
Good for removing surface stains caused by things like coffee and tea. Get an extra 40 seconds to focus on polishing your front teeth.
Your Sonicare handle detects scrubbing, a motion that decreases brushing effectiveness. If you regularly scrub, the app will recommend turning on scrubbing feedback.
By sharing your brushing data with Henry Schein, you will receive oral care updates and savings opportunities exclusive to Sonicare app users.
I allow my brushing data to be shared with Henry Schein.
2 steps, 2 minutes, and you’re on your way to complete oral healthcare with Sonicare and Henry Schein!

When you connect your toothbrush to the Sonicare App (“App”), Philips (“Philips”, “we” or “us”) provides its own services to you and processes your personal data in accordance with the App’s Privacy Notice. You may also instruct Philips to share your personal data with other third parties for purposes outside the services Philips provides – and we understand that you would like us to do so for purposes of the Remote Care Program. Therefore, by clicking on “Agree and consent” you are instructing and authorizing Philips to share the following data with Henry Schein for purposes of the Remote Care Program:
Your Philips Participant ID, which is used within Henry Schein Dentrix software program.

Please note that when you instruct us to share your personal data with Henry Schein, they will use such personal data for their own purposes in accordance with their Privacy Notices and the Remote Care Program User Agreement you signed with Henry Schein and/or your dentist. You understand Philips and Henry Schein will only use your information for purposes of the Remote Care Program; and may process your personal data at various times for the purposes mentioned above.
Your brushing data, including your associated unique Identifier(s), brushing date, timestamp (AM/PM), duration and mode, type of brush-head used, and brushing location (mouth quadrant location).
This authorization will remain valid indefinitely from the time you click on “Agree and consent”. You can always cancel this authorization sooner by revoking your consent under the App Settings.

Your App unique identifiers, which are randomly generated and allow us to identify you. We use and share these identifiers to inform Henry Schein that you have requested us to share your personal data with them and that you have provided consent and started brushing.

By clicking below I instruct Philips to share my brushing data with Henry Schein, Philips goal of bringing you continual, complete oral health care solutions reaches beyond technology. That is why Philips offers you the possibility to share your brushing data with Henry Schein in accordance with the Remote Care Program User Agreement. To protect your privacy Philips ensures that all shared data is sent in a secure way. What does this mean?

This allows your toothbrush to connect to the app when near your device.

We use device location to connect to your toothbrush through Bluetooth. Go to your phone settings to turn it on, then return to the app to continue.
This allows your toothbrush to automatically connect to the app when near your device. Keeping your brushing history up-to-date improves the tips Sonicare provides for you.
Location of your handle is required to accurately capture your brushing data.
You are successfully logged in as:
Choose your region and accept the terms of use to continue.
Go to phone settings and find your Bluetooth devices, tap on ‘Philips Sonicare’ and choose \'Forget\'/\'Unpair\'
Tap on (i) and select ‘Forget This Device’ for Philips Sonicare
Tap on manage account to update your personal information or settings. You can delete your account under communication preferences.
Please connect your toothbrush to complete the update and get the latest security enhancements.
I want to receive promotional communications.
I would like to receive promotional communications about Philips products, services and events based on my preferences. I can unsubscribe at any time.
Receive promotional communication from Philips based on my preferences and online behaviour.

As a result of your consent, Philips group companies may contact you with promotional communications via email, SMS and other digital channels, such as mobile apps and social media. To be able to tailor the communications to your preferences and behaviour and provide you with best, personalized experience, we may analyze and combine your personal data. This data may include: 


Data you give us

Data that you want to actively share with us such as: your name, date of birth or age, email address, physical address, country, gender, phone number, social media profile.


Data we get from your interactions with Philips

Data about your interactions and usage of the Philips digital channels, such as social media, websites, emails, apps and connected products. This data may include: IP address, cookies, device information communications you click on, location details , and websites you visit


Philips will give you the opportunity to withdraw your consent at anytime. 


For more information, please read the Philips Privacy notice and the Philips Cookie notice.
Philips offers exclusive deals to customers every season. To receive offers opt in to our email list {or newsletter}
Sorry, you have been logged out. Tap on the \"OK\" button to re-login to your account.
You have used %d%% of your brush.
Unable to connect. Guidance no longer available
Turn on your handle to brush
Move away from other Sonicare toothbrushes, and keep the one you\'d like to connect close to the phone.
We need you to provide nearby devices permission, because Android requires it to enable Bluetooth connectivity.
Permission must be enabled on your phone to connect to your toothbrush.

If you provide consent, we collect and process your app usage information. To do so, we use several service providers that process your app information on our behalf and pursuant to our instructions. Our service providers use cookies, tags and/or similar technologies to help us process your information.

Making the app better based on your app interactions and feedback.

fafas		To understand how you use our app, how the app runs in your mobile device, and use these insights to improve the app, we use Adobe Analytics, a service provided by Adobe Systems Software Ireland Limited. When using Adobe’s services, we (i) assign a unique identifier to your mobile device; and (ii) collect the following information: an obfuscated version of your IP address, information on your App and connected device usage, such as operating system, resolution, carrier name, city, install date, upgrades, launches, crashes, and the pages and/or features that you use.

fafas		To communicate with you and provide you with support, obtain your feedback, understand how the App runs in your mobile device, and use these insights to improve the app, we use Apptentive, a service provided by Apptentive Inc. When using Apptentive’s services, we (i) assign a unique identifier to your mobile device; (ii) collect information about your device, such as manufacturer, model, operating system and (anonymized) IP address; and (iii) process your app usage patterns and information you choose to provide to us (such as survey responses, ratings or feedback).

fafas		To understand how you access and use the app, point you directly to some app pages, and use these insights to improve the app, we use Branch Metrics, a service provided by Branch Metrics, Inc. When using Branch’s services, we collect (i) unique identifiers from your mobile device, such as iOS Identifier for Advertising, iOS Identifier for Vendors, Android Advertiser ID, 'GAID'; (Google Advertising ID) or Apple 'IDFA'; (Identifier For Advertising); and (ii) information on your app usage such as mobile platform, timestamp, API key (identifier for application), app version, hashed IP address, device model, manufacturer and device operating system, session start/stop time, mobile network code and status. 

Making the app better based on your app crash information.

We want to understand how and when the app crashes across different countries, and use these insights to fix the crashes and improve the app. To do so, we use Google Firebase Crashlytics, a service provided by Google. When using Google’s services, we (i) assign a unique identifier to your mobile device; and (ii) collect information on your mobile device, such as device brand/model, operating system, app name and version, and app crashes.
I want to help improve my App experience based on my App experience and feedback.

When you consent to receiving brushing guidance and making the app better, you allow Philips Sonicare to improve your oral health. We do so by keeping track of your progress and goals, providing personalized advice, and developing new features and solutions for you. The oral care information we process includes your brushing patterns, goals, oral care habits (such as flossing and rinsing), and your answers in our Personalization page and Focus Area (such as plaque build-up, bleeding areas, gum recession and potential cavities), which we associate to your account.
I want to help optimize app based on my App usage and crash data.
I want to receive brushing guidance based on my oral care information and help to improve the app.
Hey… looks like you haven’t allowed us to track your oral care information.

fafas		To understand how you use our app, how the app runs in your mobile device, and use these insights to improve the app, we use Adobe Analytics, a service provided by Adobe Systems Software Ireland Limited. When using Adobe’s services, we (i) assign a unique identifier to your mobile device; and (ii) collect the following information: an obfuscated version of your IP address, information on your App and connected device usage, such as operating system, resolution, carrier name, city, install date, upgrades, launches, crashes, and the pages and/or features that you use.

fafas		To communicate with you and provide you with support, obtain your feedback, understand how the App runs in your mobile device, and use these insights to improve the app, we use Apptentive, a service provided by Apptentive Inc. When using Apptentive’s services, we (i) assign a unique identifier to your mobile device; (ii) collect information about your device, such as manufacturer, model, operating system and (anonymized) IP address; and (iii) process your app usage patterns and information you choose to provide to us (such as survey responses, ratings or feedback).

fafas		To understand how you access and use the app, point you directly to some app pages, and use these insights to improve the app, we use Branch Metrics, a service provided by Branch Metrics, Inc. When using Branch’s services, we collect (i) unique identifiers from your mobile device, such as iOS Identifier for Advertising, iOS Identifier for Vendors, Android Advertiser ID, 'GAID'; (Google Advertising ID) or Apple 'IDFA'; (Identifier For Advertising); and (ii) information on your app usage such as mobile platform, timestamp, API key (identifier for application), app version, hashed IP address, device model, manufacturer and device operating system, session start/stop time, mobile network code and status.
An interval timer buzzes to tell you when to start brushing another section of your mouth, so you can get 100% coverage
This brush head features densely-packed, high-quality tufts to effectively remove plaque

Philips Sonicare brush heads are vital to our core technology of high-frequency, high-amplitude brush movements performing over 31,000 brush strokes per minute. Our unparalleled sonic technology fully extends the power from the handle all the way to the tip of the brush head. This sonic motion creates a dynamic fluid action that drives fluid deep between teeth and along the gum line for superior, yet gentle, cleaning every time.
Now it’s time to create your account.
Connect your toothbrush for personalized feedback and real-time guidance, while you brush. Customize your permissions and privacy settings in the App, at any time.
1. Hold your toothbrush next to your phone.\n2. Turn your toothbrush on. Then off.\n3. Automatically pair and connect.

dsa For the best results it’s important to replace at least every 3 months.

But now you can get smarter about this! This brush head performance monitor shows you when to replace based on your actual brushing data.

Smart sensors track your brush head effectiveness based on your actual brushing time and the pressure you apply each time your brush.

Smart Sensors collect and send a stream of data to your smartphone via Bluetooth about how long you spend brushing each area of your mouth, how much pressure you\'re using and if you are scrubbing. Along with receiving personalized coaching to improve your oral care, you can easily track and monitor any trouble areas and review your performance.
The SmarTimer indicates that your brushing cycle is complete by automatically turning off the toothbrush at the end, helping you reach the dentist recommended brushing time of two minutes.
Enjoy 19 days of brushing on a single charge. A convenient recharge indicator on the brush displays the available battery life and blinks when you need to recharge.
Philips Sonicare Diamond Clean Smart Connected
Philips Sonicare BrushSync technology combined with Amazon Dash Replenishment automatically delivers a brand new brush head to you, at the right time.
Brush head reordering is automatic and flexible with Amazon Dash Replenishment.\nEasily pause and change your brush head orders at any time
First thing’s first: Let’s check your Bluetooth connection.
Our deepest cleaning brush head that is still gentle on gums, no matter your brushing style

If you apply too much pressure, the intuitive pressure sensor will make the toothbrush handle gently vibrate so you know exactly when to adopt a softer touch. In studies, 7 out of 10 aggressive brushers successfully reduced their brushing pressure. Thank-you, pressure sensor!
Please review our privacy policy in order to continue

fsa Each of your privacy settings can be reviewed and updated at any time, within your account.
2 minutes of standard mode for a thorough, everyday clean
Removes up to 100% more surface stains for whiter teeth in just 7 days

If you apply too much pressure, the pressure sensor will alert you to protect your gums from over brushing.
Extra-long, high-density bristles to target hidden plaque caught deep between teeth

Transform your toothbrush into a powerful fresh breath solution.

Does your connected device have power? You’ll need to charge it, if you don’t see a green light when pressing the power button.
fsa Turn it on and try again.

At first glance it may not be obvious, but brush heads lose stiffness and gradually wear down over months of use. Our blue reminder bristles fade to white and help you recognize when it\'s time for a replacement. For optimal results use the Brush Head Performance Monitor in our Philips Sonicare app to track when to replace your brush head.
This brush head snaps on and off your brush handle for a secure fit and easy maintenance and cleaning.
By sharing your brushing data with ONVZ, you will receive oral care updates and savings opportunities exclusive to Sonicare app users.
I allow Philips Sonicare to share my brushing data with ONVZ to receive Sonicare approved insurance benefits.
For an effortless app experience, allow your phone and toothbrush to automatically connect when nearby.
There’s a smart brush head for all your oral care needs. Be sure to choose the brush head options that are best for you.
Simply attach your smart brush head and your toothbrush will automatically set the ideal mode and intensity, for you, every time.
Always know exactly when it\'s time to replace your smart brush head. Because replacement is based on your actual usage, you\'ll get the most out of every brush head.
Never worry about brushing too hard. To protect your gums, the pressure sensor vibrates when you apply too much pressure
Receive important information about your brushing habits and progress. Reports are your simple, reliable guide to maintaining a healthy mouth and smile.

resources.string: The chargers that come with a Sonicare toothbrush can be slightly different and you should use the same charger that came with yours. You will know that your toothbrush is in the right charger when it makes a sound and vibrates.
